About the same time it was an- nounced that a company of Abipones had at- tacked the St. Iagans in the Silvas del Hierro, as I have related elsewhere. Although this in- cursion had been headed by Oaherkaikin, it was attributed to the fellow-soldiers of Alaykin by ill-natured people, who wished to get our co- lony and its founder Barreda into disrepute. But this fable was afterwards detected by means of the captives, who, when restored to liberty, declared that their comrades were slain, and themselves made prisoners by the hordesmen of Debayakaikin.
